reviewText: Gnosis, this DVD explains, is not simply knowledge, as defined by some, but "the experience of the divine as self," "knowledge of the most esoteric kind." Writer Phillip Gardiner asserts that "present orthodox history is basically incorrect. Over the last few centuries, history has been rewritten by religious and political. Basically, says Gardiner, The "winners" get to write their story. The only negative is that the music sometimes drowns out the narration.
Title: Gnosis, the Secret of Solomon's Temple Revealed

reviewText: I'm somewhat familiar with some of this material, though I found the movie to be lacking in substance.  More so, the bad music often drowned the speaker's voice into unintelligible mumbles. You really have to focus to understand what is being said.I cannot speak for the related book, though in all I think the movie could have used better production/management and scripting to generate a more substantive message.  If anything, the video serves best as a "summary" of the author's opinion/theories and may encourage one to read further.
Title: Gnosis, the Secret of Solomon's Temple Revealed

reviewText: Being a fan of this type of history and lore, it pains me to say that this video was almost unwatchable. I did watch it all the way through to give it a fair chance but in the end, the presentation just killed the experience.The music was too loud when the narrator spoke, and the narrator's voice was just not distinct enough to make the information come alive (very monotone).  The video looked like it had been done on a home PC prior to the "new and improved" video imaging software was available.None of it made sense, even to me being a fan of this type of genre.  I gave it 2 stars based on the information alone (only because I know it).  I am not accustomed to being this critical on topics that interest me, but I cannot in good faith recommend buying this video.  If your curiosity is burning to see it, then I would suggest borrowing from a friend or checking it out from the library (if they have it).
Title: Gnosis, the Secret of Solomon's Temple Revealed

reviewText: Gnosis means knowledge and enlightenment. Using history, religion, and meditation we can attain the true enlightenment. The secret of the Temple of Solomon is about Gnosis and was pasted onto the Freemasons. The Freemasons understood the secret more that we do.
Title: Gnosis, the Secret of Solomon's Temple Revealed

reviewText: Another Gardnier style documentary with interesting information but lacking quality.  Still worth your time and interest.  Not so wordy that you feel lost.  Good for experts and newbies alike.  Gardnier put the responsibility for our lives and happiness in our own hands.
Title: Gnosis, the Secret of Solomon's Temple Revealed

reviewText: Anybody watching this who does not love the beautiful imagery, wonderful underscored music and great narration must be blind, deaf and well, daft. This is a work of art which is why it won an award and as a work of Art I suppose it can be a subjective opinion on its merits. I loved every second and have watched it again and again and again. I have now bought Secrets of the Serpent, and to be honest, it's much better, but both are brilliant.
Title: Gnosis, the Secret of Solomon's Temple Revealed

reviewText: I really enjoyed this informative presentation. Complimentary music and visuals round out this fact filled look beyond the surface of the fascinating topic of gnosis. I learned lots.
Title: Gnosis, the Secret of Solomon's Temple Revealed

reviewText: Painful to watch, Superimposed photos of symbols floating around throughout the movie plus the loud music in the background made it hard to hear what the speaker was saying.When you finally could hear what he was saying it seemed that his grandiose style and arrogance made you wish the headbanger music was louder.A total pig. Stay away from this. It's like trying to watch the Blair Witch Project while in a bumpy airplane while you have a hangover.Amateurish production with a boring and busy monologue.
summary: Busy, Confusing, Heavy Metal meets symbolic montage
Title: Gnosis, the Secret of Solomon's Temple Revealed
